parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Prop: I fasten to; I lay hold of, touch, know carnally. Reflexive of hapto; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. To touch.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A bier, an open coffin. Probably akin to the base of soreuo; a funereal receptacle, i.e. a bier.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Perhaps remotely derived from the base of basis; to lift, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
A young man, youth, an attendant. From the same as neanias; a youth.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
